code:
# @param {Integer[]} nums
# @param {Integer} k
# @return {Boolean}
def check_array(nums, k)
    # Create an array to keep track of operations needed to decrease each element to 0
    operations = Array.new(nums.size, 0)
    
    total_operations = 0
    
    nums.each_with_index do |num, i|
        # Add previous operations to current element to simulate the effect of all operations before it
        num += total_operations
        
        # Check if current element needs to be decreased
        if num > 0
            # Calculate the number of operations needed to make current element 0
            decrease_ops = num
            
            # Check if there's enough space left in the array to perform these operations
            if i + k > nums.size
                return false
            end
            
            # Record the operations needed for the current position
            operations[i] = decrease_ops
            
            # Update total operations including the current operations
            total_operations += decrease_ops
            
            # Subtract the operations at the point where the effect of current operations should end
            operations[i + k] -= decrease_ops if i + k < nums.size
        end
        
        # Subtract the operations that should no longer affect subsequent elements
        total_operations -= operations[i] if i >= k
    end
    
    true
end
